DataElement.preferredName: Package Product Material Or Class Substitution Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A container within which the product is delivered or shipped. EXAMPLE(S): a shipping carton, bottle A coded value specifying a group of products that are homogeneous or generally considered as substitutes for each other. EXAMPLE(S): stents, breakfast cereals, cox-2 inhibitors NOTE(S): The class is considered as narrow or broad depending on how substitutable the various products are.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Package Product Material Or Class Substitution Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A product container with any accompanying materials or components.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:The act of putting one thing or person in the place of another.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A product container with any accompanying materials or components.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.
